item.title: 特朗普取得决定性胜利后黄金失去光泽
item.description:
最终结果消除了世界最大经济体的巨大政治不确定性，削弱了对人人喜爱的避险投资的需求。【原文：

The definitive outcome removed a huge political uncertainty in the world’s largest economy, muting demand for everyone’s favorite safe-haven investment.

】

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普如何削弱民主党对年轻选民的影响力
item.description:
前总统通过另类媒体传播的信息引起了年轻人的共鸣，尤其是那些在高成本中挣扎的年轻人。【原文：

The former president’s messaging, disseminated through alternative media, resonated with young adults — especially those struggling with higher costs.

】

item.title: 特朗普的记分牌是 S&P 500，它是华尔街的最大希望
item.description: 如果说华尔街在唐纳德-特朗普的第一个总统任期内学到了什么，那就是股市是他记账的一种方式。他曾多次将股市上涨归功于自己，敦促美国人买跌，甚至考虑解雇美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell），因为他将股市下跌归咎于鲍威尔。【原文：If Wall Street learned one thing during Donald Trump’s first term as president, it’s that the stock market is a way he keeps score. At various points he took credit for equities rallies, urged Americans to buy the dip, and even considered firing Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell, who he blamed for a selloff.】

item.title: 苹果公司蒂姆-库克有办法应对迫在眉睫的特朗普关税
item.description: 由于严重依赖中国，苹果公司仍然容易受到唐纳德-特朗普关税的影响。但蒂姆-库克（Tim Cook）很可能有一个计划来减轻这一打击。另外：详细了解苹果公司即将推出的智能家居设备，以及该公司在 AirTags 硬件升级方面取得的进展。【原文：With its heavy reliance on China, Apple remains vulnerable to Donald Trump’s tariffs. But Tim Cook likely has a plan to soften the blow. Also: A detailed look at Apple’s upcoming smart home device, and the company makes headway on the first-ever hardware upgrade for AirTags.】

item.title: 特朗普关税担忧加剧，新兴债券看似将遭受损失
item.description: 随着投资者放弃对降息的押注、对关税贸易战的担忧加剧以及美元飙升，新兴市场本币债券的前景正在恶化。【原文：The outlook for emerging market local-currency bonds is souring as investors dump bets on interest-rate cuts, fears of a tariff trade war grow, and the dollar surges.】

item.title: 阿布扎比王室企业和首次公开募股推动阿联酋股市市值达到 1 万亿美元
item.description: 在阿拉伯联合酋长国上市的股票价值目前首次超过了 1 万亿美元，这主要得益于与阿布扎比王室有关联的公司的激增，这些公司的股票价值占总价值的三分之一以上，同时也得益于当地股票的大量上市。【原文：Stocks listed in the United Arab Emirates are now worth more than $1 trillion for the first time, helped by a surge in firms tied to an Abu Dhabi royal that account for more than a third of the total value, and a flurry of local listings.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦 Geo 电视台称本财政年度不会征收更多税收
item.description: 据 Geo 电视台报道，巴基斯坦财政部长穆罕默德-奥朗泽布（Muhammad Aurangzeb）表示，政府将不会在本财年通过任何小预算案征收更多税收，因为政府将完成税收目标。【原文：Pakistan Finance Minister Muhammad Aurangzeb said the government will not impose more taxes through any mini-budget in the current fiscal year as it’s set to meet its collection target, Geo television reported.】

item.title: 乌克兰加大扫雷力度，重振饱受战争蹂躏的农场
item.description: 九个月的俄罗斯占领使英娜-博伊科位于乌克兰南部的五万公顷农场一半以上的土地上布满了炮弹坑、烧毁的设备和危险的地雷。2022 年 11 月，当她和其他数百名农民返回米科拉耶夫州的村庄时，她决心清理田地，重新种植。【原文：Nine months of Russian occupation left more than half of Inna Boiko’s 50,000-hectare farm in southern Ukraine littered with shell craters, burnt-out equipment, and dangerous land mines. When she and hundreds of other farmers returned to their villages in the Mykolayiv region in November 2022, she was determined to clear the fields and plant again.】

item.title: 工资挤压利润后，权力向英国工人转移
item.description: 与大流行病之前相比，英国工人正在分得更多的经济蛋糕，这表明在长期劳动力短缺带来前所未有的工资议价权之后，权力的天平正在向雇主倾斜。【原文：British workers are getting a bigger slice of the economic pie than before the pandemic, signaling a shift in the balance of power away from employers after chronic labor shortages delivered unprecedented bargaining power over wages.】

item.title: 乌克兰称俄罗斯对能源目标发动导弹袭击
item.description: 乌克兰说，俄罗斯军队发动了大规模导弹和无人机袭击，目标包括能源基础设施。【原文：Russian forces launched a massive missile and drone attack, aiming at energy infrastructure objects among the targets, Ukraine said.】

item.title: 习近平表示中国将保护在朝鲜半岛的利益
item.description: 习近平主席表示，中国将防止朝鲜半岛发生冲突，这是对全球领导人的审慎回应，他们一直在推动中国在遏制朝鲜与俄罗斯军方合作的紧张局势方面发挥更大作用。【原文：President Xi Jinping said China would prevent a conflict on the Korean Peninsula, a measured response to global leaders who have been pushing his country to play a bigger role in curbing tensions over North Korea’s cooperation with Russian military.】

item.title: 卢拉的妻子在巴西 20 国集团峰会前夕大骂埃隆-马斯克
item.description: "巴西第一夫人在丈夫准备主持 20 国集团领导人高风险峰会时说："去你妈的，埃隆-马斯克。【原文：“F--- you, Elon Musk,” Brazil’s first lady said as her husband geared up to host a high-stakes summit of Group of 20 leaders.】

item.title: 特朗普盟友敦促对通过中国秘鲁港口运输的货物征收关税
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普的一位资深顾问提议，当选总统誓言对中国商品征收的 60% 关税也适用于通过中国政府在秘鲁新建港口的任何国家的商品。【原文：A veteran adviser to Donald Trump is proposing that the 60% tariffs that the President-elect has vowed to impose on Chinese goods also apply to goods from any country that pass through a new port that Beijing has built in Peru.】

item.title: 特鲁多表示支持肖尔茨与普京通话
item.description: 加拿大总理贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）对德国总理奥拉夫-肖尔茨（Olaf Scholz）周五直接与弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）通话的决定表示支持，称结束战争需要与俄罗斯总统进行一些接触。【原文：Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau gave support to the decision by German Chancellor Olaf Scholz to speak directly with Vladimir Putin on Friday, saying that ending the war will require some engagement with Russia’s president.】

item.title: 特鲁多对墨西哥与中国的贸易表示担忧
item.description: 加拿大总理贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）表示，随着北美贸易协定可能重新谈判的临近，加拿大政府对墨西哥与中国的贸易感到担忧。【原文：Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said his government has concerns about Mexico’s trade with China as a likely renegotiation of the North American trade agreement looms.】

item.title: 马里和中国公司将建炸药厂，ORTM 称
item.description: 据马里国家广播公司（ORTM）报道，马里和北京奥信化学技术有限公司（Beijing Auxin Chemical Technology Ltd.）已同意建立一家生产民用爆炸物的工厂。【原文：Mali and Beijing Auxin Chemical Technology Ltd. have agreed to build a plant to manufacture explosives for civilian use, state broadcaster ORTM reported.】

item.title: 米莱与习近平会面预示着他在中国问题上的全面转变
item.description: 阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊正准备与习近平进行首次会谈，尽管他曾嘲笑自己从未与共产党人达成过协议。【原文：Argentine President Javier Milei is preparing for his first sit-down with Xi Jinping, despite once scoffing that he’d never cut deals with communists.】

item.title: 习近平表示中方愿与特朗普合作促进两国关系
item.description: 中国领导人习近平告诉美国总统拜登，他愿意与唐纳德-特朗普合作，改善世界最大经济体之间的关系。【原文：Chinese leader Xi Jinping told US President Joe Biden that he’s ready to work with Donald Trump to improve the relationship between the world’s biggest economies.】

item.title: 英国通胀小幅回落可能使英国央行更加谨慎
item.description: 10 月份，英国通胀率很可能重新飙升至英格兰银行的目标值以上，这进一步说明政策制定者在降息时应谨慎行事。【原文：UK inflation probably surged back above the Bank of England’s target in October, reinforcing the case for policymakers to act cautiously when cutting interest rates.】

item.title: 对自律监管机构信用风险的担忧与日俱增
item.description: 市场参与者越来越担心重大风险转移（一种银行资本减免）带来的信贷风险，因为监管机构警告说，这种风险转移可能对金融稳定构成风险。【原文：Market participants are growing increasingly concerned about the credit risk from significant risk transfers, a type of capital relief for banks, amid warnings from watchdogs that they could pose a risk to financial stability.】

item.title: 拜登考虑限制化石燃料融资，这可能会让特朗普长命百岁
item.description: 拜登政府正在权衡最后一搏，争取在巴黎关键会谈开始之前达成一项国际协议，限制对外国石油和天然气项目的资金支持。【原文：The Biden administration is weighing a last-ditch push for an international agreement that would restrict financial support for foreign oil and gas projects before critical talks start in Paris.】

item.title: 马斯克在财政部竞选中支持卢特尼克胜过贝森特
item.description: 亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）表示支持霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）竞选当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的下一任财政部长。【原文：Billionaire Elon Musk voiced support for Howard Lutnick in the race for President-elect Donald Trump’s next Treasury secretary, offering a late boost to the candidacy of the Cantor Fitzgerald LP CEO as the incoming cabinet takes shape.】

item.title: 微策略公司的 260 亿美元比特币缓存比 IBM 和耐克现金控股还要大
item.description: 迈克尔-赛勒（Michael Saylor）决定在微策略公司（MicroStrategy Inc.【原文：Michael Saylor’s unorthodox decision to hold Bitcoin instead of cash on MicroStrategy Inc.’s books has vaulted the once obscure software maker into the upper echelon of the wealthiest corporations when it comes to financial assets.】

item.title: 习近平宣布中国将于 2026 年主办亚太经合组织峰会
item.description: 国家主席习近平宣布，中国将于 2026 年主办亚太经济合作组织峰会，届时将有来自 21 个成员国的领导人参加，其中可能包括美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）。【原文：President Xi Jinping announced that China will host the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation summit in 2026, which would bring leaders from the 21-member group — including potentially US President-elect Donald Trump — to the world’s second-biggest economy.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》称，TikTok 母公司字节跳动估值约 3000 亿美元
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周六报道，TikTok 的母公司字节跳动有限公司（ByteDance Ltd.）对自己的估值约为 3000 亿美元，这是中国科技公司有史以来最高的估值之一，即使该公司正在努力维持其流行的社交媒体应用在美国的存在。【原文：TikTok parent ByteDance Ltd. is valuing itself around $300 billion, one of the highest valuations ever for the Chinese tech company, even as it fights to maintain its popular social-media app’s presence in the US, the Wall Street Journal reported Saturday.】

item.title: 习近平和石破茂将在特朗普就任总统前促进中日关系
item.description: 中国国家主席习近平和日本首相石破茂在 10 月日本领导人就职以来的首次会晤中同意加强各层级的沟通。【原文：Chinese President Xi Jinping and Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba agreed to strengthen communication at all levels during their first meeting since the Japanese leader took office in October.】

item.title: 沙特抵制重申化石燃料承诺，COP29 冲突加剧
item.description: 在联合国气候谈判中，围绕各国是否应重新承诺履行去年做出的历史性承诺，即过渡到不使用化石燃料的阶段，一场争论正在酝酿之中。【原文：A fight is building at the United Nations climate talks over whether countries should recommit to last year’s historic pledge to transition away from fossil fuels.】

item.title: S&P 500 盈利前景恶化是股市反弹的坏兆头
item.description: 华尔街的分析师们正在迅速缩减对美国企业明年盈利增长的预测，这可能会在不久之后为股市的急速上涨踩下刹车。【原文：Wall Street analysts are quickly scaling back their forecasts for Corporate America’s earnings growth over the next year, which could pump the brakes on the blistering stock market rally before long.】
